1.name: The Young Philadelphians
1.description: A promising lawyer tries to handle his social and professional problems while climbing the ranks in Philadelphia.

2.name: Ben-Hur
2.description: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

3.name: Some Like It Hot
3.description: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

4.name: North by Northwest
4.description: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

5.name: Warlock
5.description: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

6.name: Rio Bravo
6.description: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

7.name: The Horse Soldiers
7.description: In 1863, a Union outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in Mississippi to destroy enemy railroads but a captive southern belle and the unit's doctor cause frictions within ranks.

8.name: Sleeping Beauty
8.description: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

9.name: The 400 Blows
9.description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

10.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
10.description: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

11.name: Anatomy of a Murder
11.description: In a murder trial, the defendant says he suffered temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

12.name: Plan 9 from Outer Space
12.description: Evil aliens attack Earth and set their terrible "Plan 9" in action. As the aliens resurrect the dead of the Earth to destroy the living, our lives are in danger.

13.name: House on Haunted Hill
13.description: A millionaire offers $10,000 to five people who agree to be locked in a large, spooky, rented house overnight with him and his wife.

14.name: Ride Lonesome
14.description: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to be tried for murder, but allows the man's outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

15.name: Imitation of Life
15.description: An aspiring actress befriends a black widow, but trouble arises when the latter is rejected by her daughter, who tries to pass for white.

16.name: Four Desperate Men
16.description: An escaped prisoner is trying to clear his name.

17.name: The Diary of Anne Frank
17.description: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

18.name: Suddenly, Last Summer
18.description: The only son of wealthy widow Violet Venable dies while on vacation with his cousin Catherine. What the girl saw was so horrible that she went insane; now Mrs. Venable wants Catherine lobotomized to cover up the truth.

19.name: On the Beach
19.description: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

20.name: Pillow Talk
20.description: A man and a woman who share a party line cannot stand each other, but he has fun romancing her with his voice disguised.

21.name: Darby O'Gill and the Little People
21.description: A wily old codger matches wits with the King of the Leprechauns and helps play matchmaker for his daughter and the strapping lad who has replaced him as caretaker.

22.name: Hiroshima Mon Amour
22.description: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

23.name: Operation Petticoat
23.description: During World War II, a commander finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

24.name: The Angry Red Planet
24.description: One of only two survivors from a Martian expedition is so traumatized she doesn't remember the circumstances of the trip.

25.name: Gidget
25.description: A young girl discovers surfing and love (in that order) during one transitive summer.

26.name: The Nun's Story
26.description: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

27.name: Look Back in Anger
27.description: A disillusioned, angry university graduate comes to terms with his grudge against middle-class life and values.

28.name: A Summer Place
28.description: A self-made businessman rekindles a romance with a former flame while their two teenage children begin a romance of their own with drastic consequences for both couples.

29.name: North West Frontier
29.description: In British India, a young prince must be taken to safey across rebel-held territory, and an old train is the only way to do it.

30.name: Black Orpheus
30.description: A retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth, set during the time of the Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro.

31.name: Pork Chop Hill
31.description: During the Korean War peace talks, U.S. troops fight to retake a hill from the Communist Chinese forces.

32.name: Li'l Abner
32.description: As Sadie Hawkins Day approaches, Daisy Mae hopes to win the hand of Li'l Abner by catching him in the traditional race. A senator comes to visit to tell the residents of Dogpatch that their...                See full summary »

33.name: The Human Condition I: No Greater Love
33.description: A Japanese pacifist, unable to face the dire consequences of conscientious objection, is transformed by his attempts to compromise with the demands of war-time Japan.

34.name: It Happened to Jane
34.description: Jane Osgood runs a lobster business, which supports her two young children. Railroad staff inattention ruins her shipment, so with her lawyer George, Jane sues Harry Foster Malone, director of the line and the "meanest man in the world".

35.name: Idol on Parade
35.description: A rock'n'roll idol is drafted into the wrong regiment.

36.name: Please Turn Over
36.description: The orderly suburban life of a 1950's English town is turned on its head when the teenaged daughter of one of the residents writes a steamy bestseller featuring characters obviously based ...                See full summary »

37.name: Pickpocket
37.description: Michel is released from jail after serving a sentence for thievery. His mother dies and he resorts to pickpocketing as a means of survival.

38.name: Porgy and Bess
38.description: A woman whose past is scorned by nearly everyone around her meets a man who'd love her regardlessly- if only everyone else would allow them to.

39.name: The Shaggy Dog
39.description: A teenage boy is cursed with periodically turning into an sheepdog.

40.name: Room at the Top
40.description: An ambitious young accountant plots to wed a wealthy factory owner's daughter, despite falling in love with a married older woman.

41.name: The Headless Ghost
41.description: Three teenagers encounter a ghost who is in limbo until he retrieves his lost head. They do their bit to help him find it.

42.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
42.description: When a nobleman is threatened by a family curse on his newly inherited estate, detective Sherlock Holmes is hired to investigate.

43.name: The Indian Tomb
43.description: A German architect runs away with the maharajah of Eschnapur's fiancee but is caught and thrown in the dungeon, while his relatives arrive from Europe looking for him and the maharajah's brother is scheming to usurp the throne.

44.name: Last Train from Gun Hill
44.description: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend, an autocratic cattle baron, to justice for his role in the rape and murder of the marshal's Native American wife.

45.name: The Mummy
45.description: In 1895, British archaeologists find and open the tomb of Egyptian Princess Ananka with nefarious consequences.

46.name: A Hole in the Head
46.description: Widower Tony is trying to keep a small Miami hotel afloat while raising a 12-year-old son. He's forced to ask his harried brother Mario for help, but he'll only bail Tony out if he quits his bohemian lifestyle and marries a sensible woman.

47.name: Good Morning
47.description: Two boys begin a silence strike to press their parents into buying them a television set.

48.name: The World of Apu
48.description: This final installment in Satyajit Ray's Apu Trilogy follows Apu's life as an orphaned adult aspiring to be a writer.

49.name: The Giant Gila Monster
49.description: A giant lizard terrorizes a rural Texas community and a a heroic teenager attempts to destroy the creature.

50.name: Green Mansions
50.description: A young man in the jungles of Venezuela meets a strange girl of the forest and falls in love with her.
